title.narrative: Improving access to quality child protection and complementary WASH services for conflict-affected population in Northwest Syria under Envelop 1 of Standard Allocation.

description.narrative:
The proposed project is designed to address the strategic priorities under Envelope 1, raised in the allocation paper by providing structured Child Protection and WASH services within a multisectoral approach to IDP children in camps in Northwest Syria.
The project will ensure safe access to foused CP activities for all children allowing them to integrate in a safe inclusive environment. This will be complemented with WASH services in the supported camps. Additionally, Child Protection component of this project aim ensure inclusion and advocate for the rights of children with a focus on children with disabilities, plan and provide training and awareness sessions on inclusion and Identify and refer people with disabilities in need of specialized support. It will also provide inclusion and PSEA raising awareness sessions to children, child resilience activities, staff speech therapy service also will be provided to enhance children with speech difficulties access to education and other services. Additionally, Case workers will support children protection cases and their families through Case Management by offering in kind assistance, referrals and follow-up to specialized external and internal services: Psychosocial support, protection assistance, referrals to specialized services including health and nutrition, and for parents and caregivers’ access to socio-economic activities, livelihood kits.
As part of multisectoral response, PIN aims through the proposed project to ensure dignified and safer living conditions in one of the targeted camps (Kafr Lucin) through the provision of WASH services integrated with its intervention under Protection. Together with regular Hygiene promotion and distributions low-cost, sustainable, environment-friendly solution for the water provision for IDPs in the targeted camp will be implemented.
The proposed action will have the duration of 12 months commencing from July 2022 and will be implemented in locations with the highest need as per the allocation’s prioritized list of locations. PIN is committed to all humanitarian principles, Code of Conduct, Child protection, PSEA and other essential policies, having a robust Accountability system at place as well, ensuring a high-quality project implementation in line with all the requirements of SCHF.
